result.execSummary:
The defendant Hajji Y. McReynolds was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Hajji Y. McReynolds is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Hajji Y. McReynolds was found guilty of Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.
  • Hajji Y. McReynolds was found guilty of Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Not to consume any alcohol, street drugs or drug paraphernalia.  No entry into bars, taverns or other places whose primary purpose is sale and consumption of alcoholic beverages.  Not to possess or use prescription drugs not legitimately prescribed for you and if so, only take those drugs in the proper therapeutic dose.  No contact with know drug users or drug dealers.  No contact with A.P. or any of his family members.  No contact with K.H.

Submit DNA sample.  Pay costs of supervision and follow rules of supervision.  complete any and all programming required by agent including but not limited to AODA and follow through on all recommendations.  Submit to random drug and alcohol testing per agent.  Undergo and complete a comprehensive mental health evaluation.

supervisions.notes: If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

denying postconviction motion
Proposed Order Denying Postconviction Motion

(09:29 AM case called.)
Defendant Hajji Y. McReynolds in court with Attorney Colleen Marie Marion. Deputy District Attorney Peter J. Rindal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Joel Larimore is also present.
State advises is relying on its written submissions.
Court makes ruling on sentencing memorandum, laid out why Judge Gabler did a written sentencing which complied with statutory guidelines. Court advises statutory guidelines were met. Court orders defense motion is denied.

Parties address bolstering by the confidential informant. State makes statement regarding the investigator testifying three times and what was stated and also what was stated by the informant. Defense advises the jury is to be the lie detector in the room and law enforcement doesn't get to make decisions whether someone is telling the truth or not. Defense advises it was the jurys' job to determine if the informant was truthful. Defense also makes note of using present tense versus past tense. State advises questions were directed toward what was happening during time of investigation and not at present tense/date/time. Court advises the language used as not vouching and there was substantial testimony from the informant. Court orders the defense motion on vouching is denied.

Parties address questioning which let to defendants gang affiliation. State notes the informant was asked how the informant knew the defendants companion and there was no further questioning or follow up regarding the defendants gang affiliation. Defense wants to make record that they viewed the video and didn't see hand to hand exchange. Defense also advises the State can't say there was no follow up since the State asked the same question again and received a little more descriptive answer. Court addresses parties and touches on problematic and credibility issues surrounding the informant. Court also advises is basing decision off of this Judges review of information and not on former Judge Gablers' information/view. Court advises there is more than enough evidence to support a conviction and there is no need for a new trial. Court orders defense motion for credibility is denied.
Attorney Joel Larimoe is excused.

Defendant requests to make a record and would like to put an objection on the record. Defendant attempts to question subsequent jurisdiction of the court and the Court advises will not be discussed. Court advises defendant any additional appeal issues need to be discussed with Attorney Marion.
Motion hearing on May 14, 2021 at 09:30 am.
to Produce/Transport

Scheduling Order.
It is hereby ordered:
1. The State shall file a response to the Petitioner's Post-Conviction Motion on or before March 12, 2021.
2. The defendant shall file a reply on or before April 16, 2021.
3. If any other acts evidence motions are filed on or before, it is the responsibility of the State to schedule a hearing date with the Court.
4. There will be an in-person motion hearing in this matter on May 14, 2021, commencing at 9 am. Two hours have been set aside for the motion hearing.

(10:00 AM case called.) All parties and court personnel appear via Zoom.
Defendant Hajji Y. McReynolds does not appear per the request of Attorney Colleen Marie Marion who appeared via video. Deputy District Attorney Peter J. Rindal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
This hearing is being held as a scheduling conference and Attorney Marion advises the defendant's appearance is not requested for this hearing.
Court advises parties due to the Covid-19 pandemic there will not be in person hearings for about 6 months. 
Attorney Marion advises she has spoken with the defendant and they are fine with scheduling about 6 months out for a motion hearing.
Court orders State's Brief/Responses are to be filed by March 12, 2021. Court orders defense reply is to be filed by April 16, 2021.
Attorney Marion advises the defendant has filed some pro se motions and may contact the Court about them, Attorney Marion does not represent the defendant on those motions.
Motion hearing scheduled for in person on 05/14/2021 from 9-11 AM.

Vacating Order Vacating Order to Appoint Counsel.
It is hereby ordered: 1. The Order Vacating Order to Appoint Counsel is vacated. 2. Attorney Gramstrup remains removed as counsel. 3. The State Public Defender's Office - Appellate Division shall appoint new counsel to represent the defendant, Hajji McReynolds.

Allowing Attorney Chris Gramstrup to Withdraw as Counsel.
It is hereby ordered: 1. Attorney Chris Gramstrup is allowed to withdraw as counsel in this matter. 2. The State Public Defender's Office - Appellate Division shall appoint new counsel to represent the defendant, Hajji McReynolds, in case 14CF872.

records.addlTxt: 01:28 PM (14CF872 & 15CF281) Defendant Hajji Y. McReynolds in court with Attorney Chris A Gramstrup.  Attorney Crystal Jensen, ADA appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense has filed a Motion to Withdraw. Court previously granted Motion, however, a Motion Hearing is being held to put facts on the record. Defendant indicates he wants an attorney to represent him. Court denies Defendant's request for an extension of time to file a new motion.  (1:33pm Defendant leaves the courtroom.) Court was unable to conduct a colloquy with defendant due to his demeanor and his eventual departure from the courtroom. Court grants Counsel's Motion to Withdraw. Court orders the Public Defender Office to appoint subsequent counsel.
